verse.roman:
hāhā-kāro mahān āsīd
bhūtānāṁ tatra paśyatām
ninadya saubha-rāḍ uccair
idam āha janārdanam

synonyms: hāhā-kāraḥ—a cry of dismay; mahān—great; āsīt—arose; bhūtānām—among the living beings; tatra—there; paśyatām—who were witnessing; ninadya—roaring; saubha-rāṭ—the lord of Saubha; uccaiḥ—loudly; idam—this; janārdanam—to Lord Kṛṣṇa.
translation: Those who witnessed this all cried out in dismay. Then the master of Saubha roared loudly and addressed Lord Janārdana.
